results.title: Painting reflections in water
results.brief_description: This is the first of a series of films made in collaboration with Eliot O’Hara, distinguished American art teacher and artist. We see O’Hara painting the complete sketch, from blocking the composition in charcoal, applying water with a broad brush, until finally the artist has painted a bright picture that seems as “wet” as the harbour where it was painted, so naturalistic is O’Hara’s technique. This is a “how-to-do-it film”, the purpose of which is to demonstrate one particular artist’s technique not to indicate critical principles or aesthetic standards.

results.title: Painting Landscape and Water in Oils
results.brief_description: A step-by-step guide showing the materials and techniques used by internationally famous artist, W.R. (Robin) Jennings. Although an artist of rare skill, Jennings is largely self-taught and his own thoughts on technique are enjoyable to follow. Notes which accompany this video cover helpful information on the equipment needed.

results.title: Painting crowds of people
results.creator_credit: Eliot O'Hara and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: In a series of watercolor demonstrations, Eliot O’Hara shows how to create impressions of crowds without defining individuals. He suggests various modes of interpretation - ways of capturing the patterns, colors, mood, and movement of crowds without details that might distract from the rhythm of a composition.

results.title: Painting clouds
results.creator_credit: Eliot O'Hara and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Describes different types of clouds, their formation, and techniques used in painting them in water-colours.

results.title: Painting an abstraction
results.brief_description: Eliot O’Hara, American artist and teacher, presents his own technique of “abstracting” desired elements for a water-colour painting. He emphasises the careful arrangement of planes and colour in a unique pattern. The same subject - treated in the film “Painting reflections in water” is used to show how purpose influences choice and technique.

results.title: Painting a province
results.creator_credit: Kirk Jones, Peter Jones and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: New Brunswick’s rugged coasts, peaceful farms and burgeoning towns have inspired artists for generations. This film shows paintings of both past and present-day artists. Seen in the film are Alex Colville, Jack Humphrey, Miller Brittain, Fred Ross, sculptor Claude Roussel, and artist-teacher Lawren Harris.

results.title: Painters painting (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Mary Lampson, Emile de Antonio and Turin Film Corporation
results.brief_description: This is a film about the postwar New York art scene featuring interviews with de Kooning, Rauschenberg, Stella, Poons, Johns, Motherwell, Warhol and others. It was a scene that de Antonio knew intimately. In line with his oeuvre, de Antonio saw this film as political. It was made with enthusiasm for the artists and their art but also with an awareness of the contradictions: commodification involving a network of two or three thousand people - the painters, the collectors, the owners and the dealers - although this is no more than implicit in the film.

results.title: Painters of Quebec
results.creator_credit: Grant Crabtree, Graham McInnes and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This film presents seven painters of Quebec: Suzor Cote, Clarence Gagnon, Marc-Aurele Fortin, Jean-Paul Lemieux, Alfred Pellan, Henri Masson and Andre Beiler. Narrated by Marius Barbeau.

results.title: Painted daughters (1925)
results.brief_description: Painted Daughters is a romantic melodrama about high society and the “flapper” generation. It tells the story of Mary Elliot and Courtland Nixon, dancing partners in the stage show “Floradora”. Mary forsakes Courtland and marries a wealthy admirer, who soon goes bankrupt and suicides, leaving her to raise a little daughter, Maryon. Following in her mother’s footsteps Maryon eventually finds success in a theatrical career. A press agent, Ernest Glenning, decides to gather the original cast of “Floradora” for a charity performance, and Mary again meets Courtland. After the Show they are both injured in an apartment fire and from their hospital beds, by telephone, they arrange their wedding to coincide with that of Maryon and Ernest.

After the Show they are both injured in an apartment fire and from their hospital beds, by telephone, they arrange their wedding to coincide with that of Maryon and Ernest.

results.title: Paint your wagon
results.creator_credit: Joshua Logan, Alan Jay Lerner and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Lee Marvin and Clint Eastwood star in this famous film version of the the stage musical. Ben Rumson (Lee Marvin) is a hard-fighting, hard-drinking, happy-go-lucky man. His ‘Pardner’ (Clint Eastwood) on the other hand is sober, quiet and gentle. The story follows their adventures in a lawless gold mining town called No Name City (population: drunk). They stick together through thick and thin and share everything including a wife (Jean Seberg). Music and lyrics by Alan J. Lerner and Frederick Loewe
